for_sales.sales_text:
"Betsy" is a Walter Easton Designed 30ft Yawl. Built at Cooks Boatyard Maldon 1930. 30 ft overall carvel planked pitch pine on oak timbers.

Long keel with a canoe stern and Bermudan yawl cutter rigged. At present laid up afloat, unrigged and in the process of refit/restoration.

Fitted with a BETA BD 1005 three cylinder 1001 cc 28 hp diesel engine. The long iron keel is bolted up under her. Internally the boat has been stripped out in preparation for refit.

Sails are ashore safely stowed and also various smaller spars, tiller and bowsprit etc. Wire standing rigging stowed ashore. Various other items of equipment have also been taken ashore for safety/stowage.

L.O.A. 30 ft L.W.L. 26ft. Beam 8ft 6ins. Draft 4ft 6ins. Displacement 7 Ton.

As noted the yacht is presently laid up afloat but under cover on deck and in a safe/secure alongside berth readily accessible at all times.

The asking price as is in the region of £3000 but open to sensible offers or a possible part exchange for a small day boat.
for_sales.summary: "Betsy" is a Walter Easton Designed 30ft Yawl. Built at Cooks Boatyard Maldon 1930. 30 ft overall carvel planked pitch pine on oak timbers.

boat.full_description:
'Betsy' is a very pretty Bermudan yawl, designed by W Easton, and built at W.Cooks Boatyard in Maldon in 1930 for Major Blewitt, D.S.O of Colchester. She has a long keel with a canoe stern and Bermudan yawl cutter rig.

In 1934 she passed into the ownership of the Royal Artillery Yacht Club who kept her until 1947. Her next two owners were also Majors, before she passed into civilian hands in 1957.

Betsy appears in every Lloyds Register issued between 1931 and 1980 when the register ceased to be published, so full information about her owners and engines is known to that point. Her sails were originally made by Gowans, although by 1980 some were also from Jeckells.

30 ft overall carvel planked, pitch pine on oak timbers.
boat.name: Betsy

ownerships.note: Built for Major Blewitt in 1930, he kept her for 4 years. She was then owned by the Royal Artillery Yacht Club from 1935- 1947, and sold on to  Major Grimshaw in 1948.
1950-6 she was owned by Major A D G Braithwaite, RA
ownerships.text: she was owned by Major A D G Braithwaite, RA

boat.short_description: Built at Cooks Boatyard Maldon 1930. 'Betsy' is 30 ft overall carvel planked pitch pine on oak timbers. Long keel with a canoe stern and Bermudan yawl cutter rigged.
